definition: smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]
to pursue/to chase/individually/one by one
color/face/countenance
surname Yan

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Knowledge makes one laugh, but wealth makes onlne dance.
sentences.chinese: 知識使人笑逐顏開，財富使人手舞足蹈。

sentences.english: It’s no surprise that the Obama children beam with life.
sentences.chinese: 我們看到奧巴馬的孩子面對生活笑逐顏開。

sentences.english: On the contrary, Singaporeans are seemed to be 'smiling away' to have her.
sentences.chinese: 相反新加坡人卻因爲從此擁有了她而“笑逐顏開”。

sentences.english: People around are beginning to beam with smiles.
sentences.chinese: 周圍的人開始笑逐顏開。

sentences.english: I grinned as I finished with a strong sense of passion.
sentences.chinese: 帶着滿腔熱忱，我完成了整套動作，笑逐顏開。

sentences.english: Things that make us smile, laugh and feel good are just awesome.
sentences.chinese: 所有讓我們笑逐顏開，感覺不錯的事都值得敬重。

sentences.english: A happy face with a big, big smile.
sentences.chinese: 一張笑逐顏開的快樂的臉。

sentences.english: Smiles is a good test it, test had no choice but to continue the bad.
sentences.chinese: 考好的呢就是笑逐顏開，考壞的只好再接再厲了。
